speaker: Ivy
text: How’s the migration going? I heard the database was moved to the new cluster last night.
ipa: haʊz ðə maɪˈɡreɪʃən ˈɡoʊɪŋ? aɪ hɜrd ðə ˈdeɪtəˌbeɪs wəz muvd tu ðə nu ˈklʌstər læst naɪt.

speaker: Marcus
text: Yeah, everything was transferred successfully. The replication lag was minimized thanks to the new architecture.
ipa: jæ, ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ wəz ˈtrænsfərd səkˈsɛsfəli. ðə ˌrɛplɪˈkeɪʃən læɡ wəz ˈmɪnəˌmaɪzd θæŋks tu ðə nu ˈɑrkɪˌtɛkʧər.

speaker: Marcus
text: They have been reconfigured, and the old monitoring rules were archived.
ipa: ðeɪ hæv bɪn ˌriˈkənˌfɪɡərd, ənd ði oʊld ˈmɒnɪtərɪŋ rulz wɜr ˈɑrˌkaɪvd.

speaker: Ivy
text: Nice. And the SSL certificates — are they still valid?
ipa: naɪs. ənd ði ˌɛsˌɛsˈɛl sərˈtɪfɪkəts — ɑr ðeɪ stɪl ˈvælɪd?

speaker: Marcus
text: Nope, new ones had to be issued during the switchover. The DNS records were updated early this morning.
ipa: noʊp, nu wʌnz hæd tu bi ˈɪʃud ˈdʊrɪŋ ðə ˈswɪʧˌoʊvər. ðə ˌdiˌɛnˈɛs ˈrɛkərdz wɜr ˈʌpˌdeɪtɪd ˈɜrli ðɪs ˈmɔrnɪŋ.

speaker: Ivy
text: Did you get the config files reviewed before the deployment?
ipa: dɪd ju ɡɛt ðə ˈkɒnˌfɪɡ faɪlz rɪˈvjud bɪˈfɔr ðə dɪˈplɔɪmənt?

speaker: Marcus
text: Yes, we had them checked by DevSecOps. A few risky defaults were flagged and fixed on time.
ipa: jɛs, wi hæd ðəm ʧɛkt baɪ ˈdɛvˌsɛkˌɒps. ə fju ˈrɪski dɪˈfɔlts wɜr flæɡd ənd fɪkst ɒn taɪm.

speaker: Marcus
text: They were notified via email yesterday. A migration FAQ was published on our support portal too.
ipa: ðeɪ wɜr ˈnoʊtɪˌfaɪd ˈviə ˈiˌmeɪl ˈjɛstərˌdeɪ. ə maɪˈɡreɪʃən ˌɛfˌeɪˈkju wəz ˈpʌblɪʃt ɒn aʊr səˈpɔrt ˈpɔrtəl tu.

speaker: Ivy
text: Solid job. Make sure the rollback plan is documented before we consider this final.
ipa: ˈsɒlɪd ʤɒb. meɪk ʃʊr ðə ˈroʊlˌbæk plæn ɪz ˈdɒkjəˌmɛntɪd bɪˈfɔr wi kənˈsɪdər ðɪs ˈfaɪnəl.
